content:
Yes, "repository" is a technical term that is primarily used in the context of software development and other technical fields. If you're looking for a more familiar term to describe a personal and organized storage location, you might consider using a term like "personal library" or "personal collection."

A personal library is a collection of books, papers, or other written materials that are kept by an individual for personal reasons. Like a repository, a personal library is organized and maintained over a longer period of time, with the intention of preserving the materials for future reference or research. However, the term "library" has more of a personal and familiar connotation than "repository," and is often used to describe a collection of books or other materials that an individual has accumulated over time.

Similarly, a personal collection might refer to any collection of items that an individual has accumulated for personal reasons, whether that be stamps, coins, artwork, or other types of objects. The term "collection" has a more informal and personal connotation than "repository," and is often used to describe a personal or family collection of items that have sentimental or other personal value.

In summary, if you're looking for a term to describe a personal and organized storage location that is familiar and easy to understand, "personal library" or "personal collection" might be good options to consider.
